text: Paralbara pallidinota is a moth in the family Drepanidae. It was described by Watson in 1968. It is found in Yunnan, China. The length of the forewings is 20–22 mm. The ground colour of the wings is brown, with the proximal half of the forewings reddish brown and the costa of the forewings is dull yellowish orange.Bulletin of the British Museum (Natural History) (Entomology) Supplement 12: 22 ==References== Category:Moths described in 1968 Category:Drepaninae Category:Moths of China
title: Paralbara pallidinota
